results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Timothy White, Richard Brennan, Smiley Films and Meridian Films
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!

results.title: Spotlight on smoking
results.brief_description: Graphs show the increase in public smoking and the marked decrease in smoking among doctors. Diagrams show what happens when smoke enters the breathing tubes and the alarming process of uncontrolled cell division which leads to cancer. Shows how mice can suffer from cancer, by painting cigarette tar on their skin. Leading personalities tell why they have given up smoking. Shows what can be bought with the money saved by giving up cigarettes over a year.

results.title: Spot news
results.brief_description: Speed is the life blood of the newspaper - by train, telegraph, telephone or radio. Reporters are covering a story of an aeroplane stunt. The reporter takes a photo, its developed in the van they are driving, and then sent via wire to the office.

results.title: Spot goes to the farm
results.brief_description: Six fabulous stories featuring Spot, the world’s favourite puppy. 1. “Spot goes to the farm” - Spot and his dad, Sam, visit a farm to find some baby animals. 2. “Spot stays overnight” - Spot stays overnight with his friend, Steve the Monkey, and almost forgets to take his teddy bear. 3. “Spot makes a cake” - Spot helps his mum Sally to make a cake for a fair. 4. “Spot goes to the park” - At the park, a friendly frog helps Spot find his ball. 5. “Spot finds a key” - Where does the key fit? Spot sets out on a search to discover the answer. 6. “Spot in the garden” - Spot has lots of fun helping his dad with the watering and mum with the vegie garden. Based on the book by Eric Hill.

results.title: Spot goes to a party
results.brief_description: Spot goes to a party: Spot has a great cowboy costume for Helen’s fancy dress party, but where are Tom and Steve? “Spot’s winter sports”: Spot and his friends have a wonderful time in the snow. When they build a snowman, Spot decides to take it home. “Spot goes to the fair”: After a lively day at the fair, Spot and his friends decide it can sometimes be fun to be frightened. “Spot’s favourite toy”: Spot can’t decide which toy he likes best, but he soon discovers his favourite at bedtime. “Spot’s first picnic”: When Spot and his friends go on a picnic they all end up wet and hungry. “Spot at the playground”: Spot, Steve and Helen love to visit the playground, where they have fun on the swings, slide and climbing frame. “Storytime with Spot”: Spot finds lots of ways to play with books as he waits for his Mum to read him a story.

results.title: Sportshort. No. 2. Denis Compton
results.creator_credit: Douglas Rankin, Adrian Reid and Exclusive Films
results.brief_description: A record of the life and accomplishments of Denis Compton, one of the greatest figures in English sporting history. In addition to showing his cricket strokes and some of his memorable performances at the wicket, the film illustrates his training methods and also his ability in other sports, including soccer, golf, and tennis.
